messages: 235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:05): for a <select> isn't there a way to specify it as an attribute to select itself which value is selected?
235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:06): for a <select> isn't there a way to specify it as an attribute to <select> itself which value is selected?
f4e183c7418b60efb39ecf44407d3d08 (13:07): ok, yes. but not with the select tag

235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:08): but then if i want to retrieve userinput, validate the inputs and print it out again as he entered it ... i would have to enumerate over all the options, compare, print selected
f4e183c7418b60efb39ecf44407d3d08 (13:08): no need for an attribute, just an attribute selector (?)
f4e183c7418b60efb39ecf44407d3d08 (13:09): I ran into that kind of problem myself yesteray
235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:09): mmh, so i need to store all the options of all <select> boxes in an array in php.. gnaah
235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:09): workworkwork, sigh, would've been sooo much easier to just say <select name="asdf" selected="valueOfOption">
f4e183c7418b60efb39ecf44407d3d08 (13:10): i see! yes it would
235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:10): mmh, no other way comes into my mind
f4e183c7418b60efb39ecf44407d3d08 (13:10): well I don't know about that array thing but i use this method
f4e183c7418b60efb39ecf44407d3d08 (13:11): and just make that list
f4e183c7418b60efb39ecf44407d3d08 (13:11): or, make it a function
235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:12): hm, good idea about the function, thx :>
235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:12): although i'd have preferred a html way, but ok : D
235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:12): i hope xhtml2 is coming soon
235c7d16517a3d035bebf1003975a024 (13:13): yup, i know my way around php, thx for the help tho
